text:
Just finished reading Chris Mullin's sequel to A VERY BRITISH COUP, THE FRIENDS OF HARRY PERKINS. An entertaining post Brexit distopian read, although at times somewhat predictable in its political messaging. I'm interviewing Chris for my podcast on Mon!

https://www.amazon.co.uk/Friends-Harry-Perkins-Chris-Mullin/dp/1471182487/ref=tmm_hrd_swatch_0?_encoding=UTF8&qid=1553385348&sr=1-1 …
author: IainDale

text: Leadership coups do not have a very good record in UK politics. Usually because they are ill thought out and carried out by the weak-willed. Anyone planning one in the next few days should study how the Australians do it. It could be a very successful national export for them!
author: IainDale

Cab driver: I recognise you...
Me: [ego expands even further]
Cab driver: I’ve had you in the cab before. You’re Julian Clary’s publicist, aren’t you?
Me: [ego deflates] No, I present a show on LBC.
Cab driver: You’re Iain Dale! I knew I recognised you!

#life

author: IainDale

text:
NEW BLOGPOST: Why Jonathan Dimbleby Will be Missed on 'Any Questions'

"Jonathan's been presenting Any Questions for 32 years - quite an astonishing achievement. He is a brilliant host. Whoever steps into Jonathan's shoes has one hell of an act to follow"

https://www.iaindale.com/articles/why-jonathan-dimbleby-will-be-missed-on-any-questions …
author: IainDale

text: Who Will be the Next LibDem Leader (And Does it Matter)? http://dlvr.it/R10vbD
author: IainDale

text:
NEW BLOGPOST: Who Will be the Next LibDem Leader (And Does it Matter)?

"Does it really matter who leads the Liberal Democrats? Do they even matter any longer? Yes, they do. British politics needs a strong centrist, liberal party."

https://www.iaindale.com/articles/who-will-be-the-next-libdem-leader …
